parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Returns medications for a specific code

parameters.name: expiration-date
parameters.description: Returns medications in a batch with this expiration date

parameters.name: form
parameters.description: Returns medications for a specific dose form

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Returns medications with this external identifier

parameters.name: ingredient
parameters.description: Returns medications for this ingredient reference

parameters.name: ingredient-code
parameters.description: Returns medications for this ingredient code

parameters.name: lot-number
parameters.description: Returns medications in a batch with this lot number

parameters.name: manufacturer
parameters.description: Returns medications made or sold for this manufacturer

form.description: Describes the form of the item.  Powder; tablets; capsule.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

status.description: A code to indicate if the medication is in active use.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

MedicationAdministration.description: Administration of medication to a patient

category.description: Indicates where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered.

context.description: Encounter or Episode of Care administered as part of

effective[x].description: Start and end time of administration

eventHistory.description: A list of events of interest in the lifecycle

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

note.description: Extra information about the medication administration that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

partOf.description: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.

reasonCode.description: A code indicating why the medication was given.

reasonReference.description: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was administered.

request.description: The original request, instruction or authority to perform the administration.

status.description: in-progress | not-done | on-hold | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | unknown

statusReason.description: A code indicating why the administration was not performed.

subject.description: The person or animal or group receiving the medication.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

rate[x].description: Dose quantity per unit of time

text.description: Free text dosage instructions e.g. SIG

MedicationDispense.description: Dispensing a medication to a named patient

authorizingPrescription.description: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.

context.description: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this event.

daysSupply.description: The amount of medication expressed as a timing amount.

dosageInstruction.description: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

eventHistory.description: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the dispense was verified.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

location.description: The principal physical location where the dispense was performed.

note.description: Extra information about the dispense that could not be conveyed in the other attributes.

partOf.description: The procedure that trigger the dispense.

quantity.description: The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

status.description: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.

statusReason[x].description: Indicates the reason why a dispense was not performed.

subject.description: A link to a resource representing the person or the group to whom the medication will be given.

supportingInformation.description: Additional information that supports the medication being dispensed.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

type.description: Trial fill, partial fill, emergency fill, etc.

whenHandedOver.description: The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.

whenPrepared.description: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.

function.description: Who performed the dispense and what they did

responsibleParty.description: Who is responsible for the substitution

type.description: Code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed

wasSubstituted.description: Whether a substitution was or was not performed on the dispense

associatedMedication.description: A medication resource that is associated with this medication

contraindication.description: Potential clinical issue with or between medication(s)

doseForm.description: Describes the form of the item.  Powder; tablets; capsule.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

intendedRoute.description: The intended or approved route of administration.

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

preparationInstruction.description: The instructions for preparing the medication.

productType.description: Category of the medication or product

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

dosage.description: Dosage for the medication for the specific guidelines

indication[x].description: Indication for use that apply to the specific administration guidelines

patientCharacteristics.description: Characteristics of the patient that are relevant to the administration guidelines

dosage.description: Dosage for the medication for the specific guidelines

characteristic[x].description: Specific characteristic that is relevant to the administration guideline

source.description: The source or owner for the price information

type.description: The category of the cost information
Code specifying the type of characteristic of medication

item[x].description: Medication(s) or substance(s) contained in the medication

areaUnderCurve.description: The drug concentration measured at certain discrete points in time

halfLifePeriod.description: Time required for concentration in the body to decrease by half

lethalDose50.description: The median lethal dose of a drug

classification.description: Specific category assigned to the medication

type.description: The type of category for the medication (for example, therapeutic classification, therapeutic sub-classification)
Type of program under which the medication is monitored

quantity.description: The number of product units the package would contain if fully loaded

type.description: A code that defines the specific type of packaging that the medication can be found in

maxDispense.description: The maximum number of units of the medication that can be dispensed in a period

regulatoryAuthority.description: Specifies the authority of the regulation

schedule.description: Specifies the schedule of a medication in jurisdiction

substitution.description: Specifies if changes are allowed when dispensing a medication from a regulatory perspective

period.description: The period that applies to the maximum number of units

quantity.description: The maximum number of units of the medication that can be dispensed

allowed.description: Specifies if regulation allows for changes in the medication when dispensing

type.description: Specifies the type of substitution allowed

reference.description: Associated documentation about the associated medication knowledge

MedicationRequest.description: Ordering of medication for patient or group

authoredOn.description: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

basedOn.description: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

courseOfTherapyType.description: The description of the overall patte3rn of the administration of the medication to the patient.

doNotPerform.description: If true indicates that the provider is asking for the medication request not to occur.

dosageInstruction.description: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

encounter.description: Encounter created as part of encounter/admission/stay

eventHistory.description: A list of events of interest in the lifecycle

groupIdentifier.description: Composite request this is part of

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

intent.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

note.description: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

performerType.description: Indicates the type of performer of the administration of the medication.

priorPrescription.description: A link to a resource representing an earlier order related order or prescription.

priority.description: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

reasonCode.description: The reason or the indication for ordering or not ordering the medication.

reasonReference.description: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.

status.description: active | on-hold | cancelled | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | draft | unknown

statusReason.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationRequest.

subject.description: Who or group medication request is for

supportingInformation.description: Information to support ordering of the medication

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

dispenseInterval.description: Minimum period of time between dispenses

expectedSupplyDuration.description: Number of days supply per dispense

quantity.description: Amount of medication to supply per dispense

validityPeriod.description: Time period supply is authorized for

allowed[x].description: Whether substitution is allowed or not

MedicationStatement.description: Record of medication being taken by a patient

basedOn.description: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

category.description: Indicates where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered.

context.description: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this MedicationStatement.

dateAsserted.description: The date when the medication statement was asserted by the information source.

dosage.description: Indicates how the medication is/was or should be taken by the patient.

effective[x].description: The date/time or interval when the medication is/was/will be taken

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

informationSource.description: Person or organization that provided the information about the taking of this medication

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

partOf.description: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.

reasonCode.description: A reason for why the medication is being/was taken.

reasonReference.description: Condition or observation that supports why the medication is being/was taken.

status.description: active | completed | entered-in-error | intended | stopped | on-hold | unknown | not-taken

statusReason.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationStatement.

subject.description: The person, animal or group who is/was taking the medication.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

url.description: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

period.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

system.description: The namespace for the identifier value

display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

identifier.description: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known

reference.description: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL

lastUpdated.description: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.

profile.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to

security.description: Security Labels applied to this resource

source.description: Identifies where the resource comes from

div.description: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.

code.description: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

system.description: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

userSelected.description: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

version.description: Version of the system - if relevant

end.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.
